page.title: 13THE MONMOUTH REGATTA
page.content: {Monmouth Regatta}was founded in{1872,} but it lapsed for a while. On{Whit {Sunday, 1985}there was a record entry of over a{thousand competitors consisting of{232 teams and 50 {umpires.}There was a race every three minutes from 0900-1930 and the organisation was very efficient. A lot of clubs travelled from{Worcester}to{ {Monnmouth}to{Hereford}in three days to attend these three major regattas in the South West. The main events this year were won by: {Monmouth School}Senior A Coxed 4's. {Thames Tradesmen}Elite 8's. {City of Oxford}Elite coxless 4's. {Kingston}Elite sculls. This year's event was typical in that no crews entered from Europe, Scotland or Ireland.
